relationships.evidence_text: Dominique Martin fils de la prevenue
Catherine Mathieu femme Jean de Fribourg, maire de St Maurice
Husband had 'une fort mauvaise frequentation' with Pierrotte over several years; commonly lived, ate, and slept in her house
Her late sister Marie had good reputation

economic_context.details: Multiple carting disputes; accused paid 600 francs for house in coin which astonished community given prior poverty; money allegedly earned 'estante vivandiere a la fleau du temps'; sold valuable items (silver belt buckle, gold and silver rings) after deaths of Adrian Barbier and André Gerardin; multiple witnesses testified to economic transactions

harms_catalog.harm_description: Severe illness with swollen stomach and thigh all blue and swollen after eating pears
Fatal illness lasting 28 weeks after taking tax farm from accused

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband didn't cart wood soon enough

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died within 24 hours or 2-3 days, sudden death after being joyful at supper

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to cart cider and straw

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill after drinking to sale of horse in her house

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Beat him 3 times for stealing gooseberries, throwing egg, driving him out

harms_catalog.harm_description: Often had 'foiblesses' in church after beatings

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to continue carting wood; she threatened to take him to court

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horses refused to pull loaded cart after refusing to cart hay for her
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to cart hay because already committed to Mre Echevin

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horse sickened and died after 18 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over payment for vins when buying horse

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fatal illness began after feeling something prick his thigh while she talked with him
Cow sickened and died in 2-3 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mother asked for milk and was refused

harms_catalog.harm_description: Bewitched after eating her cake; has haunted him since; hated his wife and left house

material_culture.context: Given to Mongeon Bernard after childbirth; suspected of poisoning
Made with olive oil, lard from stag, and brandy; used for healing
Advised putting empty flour sack on sick horse's back
Sold by accused; bought by Magdelaine Mathis
Sold by accused after deaths of Adrian Barbier and André Gerardin
Given as presents to Catherine Durand
Gambling stake worth quarter of an écu
Meat that was very white with funny smell; suspected of being human flesh
Large sum paid in coin for house, astonished community
Dispute with Guillaume Parmentier over bond
La Varenne used magical test with note on broom by fire
Used to revive accused when she had seizures
Attempted to wake unconscious accused with holy water

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused
Residence of Catherine Mathieu and maire Jean de Fribourg
Residence of Guillaume Parmentier and others
Carting location; residence of maire Anthoine Jean Roy
Where accused's father went to live after being told to leave Badonviller
Region where accused claimed to have used healing grease successfully
Germany; mentioned in context of son straining himself with peas
Son Dominique said he went to feast there
Where accused allegedly seen with marguillier

historical_context.military_details: Extensive military references: soldiers billeted in houses; Capitaine la Vervenne; maréchal des logis Verenne; winter quarters; siege by Dequenfeld; town besieged and defended by bourgeois; women dressed as men during siege; time 'when people were eating human flesh'; references to soldiers stealing; 'fleau du temps' (scourge of the times)
economic_hardship_indicators: Time when people were eating human flesh
Accused previously very poor but later had 600 francs
Multiple references to poverty and economic disputes
religious_calendar_references: St George's Day (April 23) - when accused gave birth
Easter - when Catherine Durand was recently married

prior_legal_disputes.description: Father Jean Roy called witch by Demenge Durand; took him to court but couldn't afford costs; left town
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Father ordered to leave town same day

prior_legal_disputes.description: Accused sued Anthoine Valet for calling her witch; claimed he was not subject to local court
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: She took no action despite witnesses (1637)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Catherine Durand's father called mother of accused a witch; summoned to audience; father 'cria mercy'

legal_context.redress_outcome: Multiple instances: filed suit against Anthoine Valet but he claimed ducal jurisdiction; chased Catherine Durand with stones after being called witch
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Imprisoned during proceedings; worried about costs falling on her; sent daughter's clothing to be sold

hearsay_chains.content: Overheard talk about grease 9 years earlier
Never well since quarrelling with accused
Story about death of second husband
Daughter talked of grease, son talked of black goat
Could charm 'chiques' to win; sister had shining lovers
Horse fell when it saw accused
Stories told by Dominique at second hand

emotional_state_notes: Said 'qu'elle remettoit le tout a la volonté de dieu qu'il mette le droict ou il debvoit estre'
Became ill when angry, throwing herself about

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Subornée by Jacob le Heu; previously said she didn't suspect her
Heard she put something in cake to kill first husband; caused his death
Left town because of sexual relations with soldiers; lied like a whore
Stole money, slept 50+ times with Magnier, was whore before marriage
Slept with Simon Cunin while 'en promesses'
Was whore during wars; soldier drove her away because she killed horses
Boasted of having 4 children by Marie Marchal; house was center for thieving soldiers
Suspected over death of Gaultier whom he abandoned when ill
'un voleur un laron et faux accusateur'; claimed to be 'prince des diables'; extorted money
Too young to depose; had 'tiré le membre viril' of her son

third_parties.context: Died after quarrel with accused; first husband of witness Mongeon Bernard

third_parties.name: Maréchal des logis Verenne
third_parties.context: Claimed she was witch and used magical test with broom

third_parties.name: Adrian Barbier

third_parties.name: Me Demenge Vuiant/Marguillier

third_parties.name: Claudatte Martin
third_parties.context: Talked about grease, trembled in church, said she was with the devil

third_parties.name: Le curé of Badonviller
third_parties.context: Priest who borrowed linen from accused

third_parties.name: Mother of accused
third_parties.context: Called witch; caused death of cow; chased away from town

third_parties.name: Sarra Grazy femme Demenge Pierre
third_parties.context: Held cloth for accused during imprisonment

third_parties.name: Catherine Pelletier
third_parties.context: Mother imprisoned as witch but accuser condemned; defended town during siege dressed as man

extraction_metadata.notes: Large trial with 68 witnesses and extensive confrontations spanning over a year. Document includes only depositions, confrontations, and draft interrogation questions - no final verdict or sentence recorded. Key features: (1) Formal accuser Jacob le Heu claimed to be bewitched by accused's food; (2) Multiple witnesses testified to husband's long affair with accused; (3) Accused made vigorous defense, counter-accusing many witnesses of sexual misconduct, theft, and other crimes; (4) Both parents previously suspected as witches and forced to leave town; (5) Death of second husband André Gerardin highly suspicious (died 2-3 days after she said he wouldn't be portier much longer); (6) Accused practiced healing with grease (olive oil, stag lard, brandy); (7) Economic status: previously poor but acquired 600 francs to buy house, claimed as vivandiere earnings; (8) Military context pervasive throughout trial; (9) Accused had episodes of 'mal caducque' (epilepsy); (10) Multiple carting disputes with economic overtones. Missing pages noted in original document. No evidence of torture application despite draft questions prepared. Outcome unknown - trial appears incomplete.
